intro: Trachelospermum jasminoides, commonly known as the star jasmine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and typically have a glossy texture. Trachelospermum jasminoides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and pleasant aroma.
